feat_req__example__some_title.content:
With this requirement we can check if the removal of the prefix is working correctly.
It should remove id_prefix (SCORE _) as it's defined inside the BUILD file and remove it before it checks the leftover value
against the allowed defined regex in the metamodel
Note: The ID is different here as the 'folder structure' is as well
feat_req__example__some_title.title: Some Title

feat_req__testing__some_title.content:
With this requirement we can check if the removal of the prefix is working correctly.
It should remove id_prefix (SCORE _) as it's defined inside the BUILD file and remove it before it checks the leftover value
against the 'allowed' defined regex in the metamodel
feat_req__testing__some_title.title: Some Title

stkh_req__index__test_requirement.content:
Some content to make sure we also can render this
This is a link to an external need inside the 'score' documentation.
:need:`SCORE_feat_req__kvs__config_file`.
Note how it starts with the defined prefix but in UPPERCASE. This comes from sphinx-needs, `see here <https://github.com/useblocks/sphinx-needs/blob/master/sphinx_needs/external_needs.py#L119>`_
stkh_req__index__test_requirement.rationale: A simple requirement we need to enable a documentation build
stkh_req__index__test_requirement.title: TestTitle

stkh_req__testing__test_requirement.content:
Some content to make sure we also can render this.
This is a link to an external need inside the 'score' documentation.
:need:`SCORE_feat_req__kvs__config_file`.
Note how it starts with the defined prefix but in UPPERCASE. This comes from sphinx-needs, `see here <https://github.com/useblocks/sphinx-needs/blob/master/sphinx_needs/external_needs.py#L119>`_
stkh_req__testing__test_requirement.rationale: A simple requirement we need to enable a documentation build
stkh_req__testing__test_requirement.title: TestTitle

tool_req__docs_arch_attr_fulfils.content:
Docs-As-Code shall enforce and check for linking of need to specific levels. This is done via the ``fulfils`` attribute.
In the table underneath you can see which need type can link to which other one

.. table::
   :widths: auto


   ====================================  ==========================================
   Requirement Type                      Allowed Link Target
   ====================================  ==========================================
   Functional feature requirements       Static / dynamic feature architecture
   Interface feature requirements        Interface feature architecture
   Functional component requirements     Static / dynamic component architecture
   Interface component requirements      Interface component architecture
   ====================================  ==========================================
tool_req__docs_arch_attr_fulfils.parent_has_problem: YES: Attribute is not mentioned. Link direction not clear. Fig. 22 does not contain 'fulfils'
tool_req__docs_arch_attr_fulfils.title: Mandatory Architecture Attribute: fulfils

tool_req__docs_arch_diag_draw.content:
Docs-As-Code shall enable the rendering of diagramms for the following views:

* Feature View & Component View:
   *  Static View
   *  Dynamic View
   *  Interface View
* SW Module View
* Platform View
tool_req__docs_arch_diag_draw.title: Support Diagramm drawing of architecture

tool_req__docs_arch_security_linkage.content:
Docs-As-Code shall enforce that needs that are security relevant meaning ``security == YES`` can only be
linked to other needs that are also security relevant.

This shall be enforced when:

* both linked needs are architecture elements (TODO; see https://github.com/eclipse-score/process_description/issues/34)
tool_req__docs_arch_security_linkage.title: Restrict linakge of security architecture elements

tool_req__docs_arch_types.content:
docs-as-code shall support following architecture types ??

* Feature Architecture Static View (feat_arch_static) - does this count as an architecture type, or is it a view?
* Feature Architecture Dynamic View (feat_arch_dyn) - the views below have view in their type name!!
* Logical Architecture Interfaces (logic_arc_int) - That's a single interface and not "interfaces"? Or is it a view?
* Logical Architecture Interface Operation (logic_arc_int_op)
* Module Architecture Static View (mod_view_static)
* Module Architecture Dynamic View (mod_view_dyn)
* Component Architecture Static View (comp_arc_sta)
* Component Architecture Dynamic View (comp_arc_dyn)
* Component Architecture Interfaces (comp_arc_int)
* Component Architecture Interface Operation (comp_arc_int_op)
* Real interface?? (see gd_req__arch__build_blocks_corr)
* Feature Architecture Interface?? (see gd_req__arch__traceability)

.. warning::
   This is a temporary requirement, used to gain some oversight.
tool_req__docs_arch_types.title: Architecture Types

tool_req__docs_attr_description.content:
Each requirement must contain a description (content).

This applies to all :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types`
tool_req__docs_attr_description.title: Enforces presence of description

tool_req__docs_attr_id.content:
Docs-As-Code shall ensure that Need IDs are globally unique.

.. note::
   Implementation note (in some sort of DR in the future??).
   IDs are unique within one docs-instance, this is guaranteed by sphinx-needs.
   Several docs-instances are always independent. When they are linked, they always
   receive unique prefixes for their IDs.
tool_req__docs_attr_id.title: Enforces need ID uniqueness

tool_req__docs_attr_id_scheme.content:
Docs-As-Code shall ensure that Need IDs adhere to the following:

* Start with the need type (e.g. ``feature__``)
* Include the feature name (for feature requirements)
   * Requirement Attribute UID: some part of the feature tree / component acronym
   * Architecture Attribute UID: last part of the feature tree
* Have additional text

This applies to all :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types`
tool_req__docs_attr_id_scheme.title: Enforces need ID scheme

tool_req__docs_attr_impl.content:
Docs-As-Code shall allow for Source code to link requirements.
A backlink pointing to the code in Github shall be generate in the output as an attribute of said requirement.
tool_req__docs_attr_impl.title: Supports linking to source code

tool_req__docs_attr_rationale.content: Each stakeholder requirement must contain a non-empty ``rationale`` attribute.
tool_req__docs_attr_rationale.parent_covered: NO: Can not ensure correct reasoning
tool_req__docs_attr_rationale.title: Enforces rationale attribute

tool_req__docs_attr_safety.content:
Docs-As-Code shall ensure that every need of type :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types` (except Process Requirements) shall have a automotive safety integrity
level (``safety``) attribute, which must be one of:

* QM
* ASIL_B
* ASIL_D
tool_req__docs_attr_safety.parent_has_problem: YES: Architecture talks about requirements. Parents not aligned
tool_req__docs_attr_safety.title: Enforces safety classification (requirements, architecture)

tool_req__docs_attr_security.content:
The ``security`` attribute must be one of:

* YES
* NO

This applies to:

* all :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types` except process requirements.
* all architecture elements (TODO; see https://github.com/eclipse-score/process_description/issues/34)
tool_req__docs_attr_security.parent_has_problem: YES: Architecture talks about requirements. Parents not aligned.
tool_req__docs_attr_security.title: Enforces security classification

tool_req__docs_attr_status.content:
Docs-As-Code shall ensure that every need of type :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types` has a ``status`` attribute,
which must be one of:

* valid
* invalid
tool_req__docs_attr_status.title: Enforces status classification (requirements, architecture)

tool_req__docs_attr_title.content:
Docs-As-Code shall ensure that requirement titles must not contain the words:

* shall
* must
* will

This applies to all :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types`
tool_req__docs_attr_title.title: Enforces title wording rules

tool_req__docs_attr_type.content:
Docs-As-Code shall enforce that each requirement has an ``reqtype`` attribute, which
must be one of:

* Functional
* Interface
* Process
* Legal
* Non-Functional

This applies to all :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types`
tool_req__docs_attr_type.parent_has_problem: YES: tool_req shall not have 'reqtype' as discussed
tool_req__docs_attr_type.title: Enforces requirement type classification

tool_req__docs_covered.parent_has_problem: YES: Not understandable what is required.
tool_req__docs_covered.title: Enables marking requirements as "covered"

tool_req__docs_doc_attr.content:
Docs-As-Code shall enforce that a 'document' need has the following attributes:

* author
* approver
* reviewer
tool_req__docs_doc_attr.parent_has_problem: YES: Which need type to use for this?
tool_req__docs_doc_attr.title: Mandatory Document attributes

tool_req__docs_doc_attr_approver.content:
Docs-As-Code shall implement an automatic way to determin the appropriate approver.
This attribute shall be the *last CODEOWNER APPROVER* of the file that contains the document.
The last PR touching the relevant file is the basis for this.
tool_req__docs_doc_attr_approver.title: Document approver is autofilled

tool_req__docs_doc_attr_reviewer.content:
Docs-As-Code shall implement an automatic way to determin the appropriate reviewers.
This attribute shall contain all reviewers that are not mentioned under the 'approver' attribute.
The last PR touching the relevant file is the basis for this.
tool_req__docs_doc_attr_reviewer.title: Document reviewer is autofilled

tool_req__docs_doc_autofill_author.content:
Docs-As-Code shall implement an automatic way to determin the authors.
Authors with more than 50% of content addition, shall be considerd as author.
tool_req__docs_doc_autofill_author.parent_has_problem: YES: Unclear how the contribution % is counted and how to accumulate %. Committer is a reserved role.
tool_req__docs_doc_autofill_author.title: Document author is autofilled

tool_req__docs_doc_types.content:
Docs-As-Code shall support following document types:

* Generic Document (document)
tool_req__docs_doc_types.title: Document Types

tool_req__docs_req_saftety_link.content:
Docs-As-Code shall enforce that architecture needs of type :need:`tool_req__docs_arch_types` that are safety relevant meaning ``safety != QM`` shall be
linked to needs of type :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types` that are also safety relevant.
tool_req__docs_req_saftety_link.title: Mandate links for safety requirements

tool_req__docs_req_saftety_link_trace.content:
Docs-As-Code shall enforce that architecture needs of type :need:`tool_req__docs_arch_types` that are safety relevant meaning ``safety != QM`` can only be
linked to architecture needs of type :need:`tool_req__docs_arch_types` if they are also safety relevant.
tool_req__docs_req_saftety_link_trace.title: Restrict links for safety requirements

tool_req__docs_req_test_cov.content:
Docs-As-Code shall allow for every need of type :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types` to have a ``testcovered`` attribute,
which must be one of:

* Yes
* No
tool_req__docs_req_test_cov.title: Support requirements test coverage

tool_req__docs_req_types.content:
dosc-as-code shall support following requirement types:

* Stakeholder requirement (stkh_req)
* Feature requirement (feat_req)
* Component requirement (comp_req)
* Assumption of use requirement (aou_req)
* Process requirement (gd_req)
* Tool requirement (tool_req)
tool_req__docs_req_types.title: Requirements Types

tool_req__docs_satisfies.content:
Docs-As-Code shall allow and check for linking of need to specific levels. This is done via the ``satisfies`` attribute.
In the table underneath you can see which need type can link to which other one

.. table::
   :widths: auto

   ========================  ===========================
   Requirement Type          Allowed Link Target
   ========================  ===========================
   Feature Requirements      Stakeholder
   Component Requirements    Feature Requirements
   Process Requirements      Workflows
   Tooling Requirements      Process Requirements
   ========================  ===========================
tool_req__docs_satisfies.parent_has_problem: YES: Mandatory for all needs? Especially some tool_reqs do not have a process requirement.
tool_req__docs_satisfies.title: Enables needs linking via satisfies attribute

tool_req__docs_std_req_types.content:
dosc-as-code shall support following requirement types:

* Standard requirement (std_req)
tool_req__docs_std_req_types.title: Standard Requirement Types

tool_req__docs_test_case_linkage.content:
Docs-as-code shall allow for a testlink attribute in needs of type :need:`tool_req__docs_req_types`
It shall be possible to link testcases to needs via this attribute.
tool_req__docs_test_case_linkage.title: Supports linking to test cases

tool_req__docs_tvr_safety.content:
Docs-As-Code shall ensure that every Tool Verification Report has a ``safety_affected`` attribute, which must be one of:

* YES
* NO
tool_req__docs_tvr_safety.parent_has_problem: YES: Safety affected vs Safety relevance
tool_req__docs_tvr_safety.title: tool verification report: Enforce safety classification

tool_req__docs_tvr_security.content:
Docs-As-Code shall ensure that every Tool Verification Report has a ``security_affected`` attribute, which must be one of:

* YES
* NO
tool_req__docs_tvr_security.parent_has_problem: YES: Safety affected vs Safety relevance
tool_req__docs_tvr_security.title: tool verification report: enforce security classification

tool_req__docs_tvr_status.content:
Docs-As-Code shall ensure each Tool Verification Report has a ``status`` attribute, which must be one of:

* draft
* evaluated
* qualified
* released
* rejected
tool_req__docs_tvr_status.title: tool verification report: enforce status classification (tool verification report)

tool_req__docs_tvr_uid.content: Docs-As-Code shall support the Tool Verification Report (tool_verification_report).
tool_req__docs_tvr_uid.title: Tool Verification Report

tool_req__docs_wf_types.content:
dosc-as-code shall support following workflow types:

* Workflow (wf)
tool_req__docs_wf_types.title: Workflow Types

arch.description: Mapping of uml key to uml content.

constraints.description: List of constraint names, which are defined for this need.

constraints_error.description: An error message set if any constraint failed, and `error_message` field is set in config.

constraints_passed.description: True if all constraints passed, False if any failed, None if not yet checked.

constraints_results.description: Mapping of constraint name, to check name, to result.

docname.description: Name of the document where the need is defined (None if external).

doctype.description: Type of the document where the need is defined, e.g. '.rst'.

external_css.description: CSS class name, added to the external reference.

external_url.description: URL of the need, if it is an external need.

has_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list.

has_forbidden_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list, and the link type does not allow dead links.

is_external.description: If true, no node is created and need is referencing external url.

is_modified.description: Whether the need was modified by needextend.

is_need.description: Whether the need is a need.

is_part.description: Whether the need is a part.

jinja_content.description: Whether the content should be pre-processed by jinja.

layout.description: Key of the layout, which is used to render the need.

lineno.description: Line number where the need is defined (None if external).

parts.description: Mapping of parts, a.k.a. sub-needs, IDs to data that overrides the need's data

signature.description: Derived from a docutils desc_name node.

style.description: Comma-separated list of CSS classes (all appended by `needs_style_`).
